title: In a neon tube, what occurs immediately after an atom is excited? - Quora

response.answer_text: -atom (of e.g. Mercury vapour) becomes de-excited, releasing a photon in the UV range -atoms of fluorescent lining on the walls of the tube absorb these photons and then get excited -when they de-excite, they release photons in steps in the visible range of the EM spectrum
“In a neon tube, what occurs immediately after an atom is excited?” If by “immediately” you mean within nanoseconds, the neon decays back to the ground state with the emission of a photon.
